text: James E. Buskey (born April 10, 1937) is an American politician. He was a member of the Alabama House of Representatives from the 99th District, serving from 1976 to 2018. He is a member of the Democratic party. In 1997, Buskey ran in the special election to succeed Michael Figures in the Alabama Senate. He lost to Vivian Davis Figures.https://www.newspapers.com/image/106744754/?terms=vivian%2Bdavis%2Bfigures ==References== Category:Living people Category:Members of the Alabama House of Representatives Category:Alabama Democrats Category:1937 births Category:21st- century American politicians Category:African-American state legislators in Alabama
title: James Buskey
